column4: I thought that apt-get install msttcorefonts would work, but it doesn't and MS site says they are no longer available?
Is there another way to get the fonts easily?
they work for me - there are in multiverse
oh.. I thought they were supposed to be in Universe.  Multiverse is different?
just put multiverse after ant lines that have universe in them in your /etc/apt/sources.list
ant lines ?
any lines
how do I find out the URL of multiverse? (sorry, I've never done this)
any line that has universe in it, just type multiverse on that line after it
eg deb http://au.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu breezy universe multiverse is a line from mine
ok, thanks.  I'll try it.  Just "multiverse" on a line after any URL with "universe"
so you mean copy the same URL format but substitute the word "multiverse"?
did you remove the # from in front of those lines??
I have one line from Universe uncommented.  The other one is still commented.  Should they both be uncommented?
you dont need the deb-src lines, leave them commented
after amending, run : sudo apt-get update, then try for the software you want
just add "multiverse" directly after the word "universe" right?
yup
ok... I'll try it again now. thanks.
It worked this time.  I think last time I forgot the sudo apt-get update part and that is why it didn't work
np
